document.masterDocTitle: The lanternfly genus Penthicodes: key to the species and review of the “ Ereosoma group ” with two new species and one new subspecies (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Fulgoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The lanternfly genus Penthicodes: key to the species and review of the “ Ereosoma group ” with two new species and one new subspecies (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Fulgoridae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Penthicodes bimaculata (
Schmidt, 1905
)
; erroneously synonymised by
Nagai & Porion, 1996
: 20
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes: (
1
) the species is easy to separate from
P. bimaculata
, by the 2 white spots of nodal line along the sutural and costal margins of the tegmina (only one spot also along sutural margin in
P. bimaculata
). The very similar
P. variegata
is known only from continental Asia, shows smaller spots on hind wings, and hind wings always orange with base red. (
2
) the erroneous synonymy with P. b i m a c u l a t a proposed by
Nagai and Porion ( 1996 )
was obviously based on superficial observation of the two species and did not take in account the male genitalic characters.

Typical material examined: Holotype ɞ: [Java, Fruhstorfer] [ Type ] [
Penthicodes quadrimaculata Lall. V. Lallemand
det., 1961 ]( FSAG ).
